cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi ENE of Great Abaco Island and 210 mi E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, expected to turn WNW tonight and NW on Thursday, taking the center onto Florida’s east coast (near Boca Raton–Vero Beach) then across northern Florida into Georgia and the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast within the Hurricane Warning area (around Boca Raton–Vero Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef, FL (includes Miami-Dade coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None affecting PortMiami (Hurricane and TS warnings start north of Boca Raton)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast from Ocean Reef northward past Palm Beach, plus entire east-central Florida shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Wednesday night through Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along Biscayne Bay and the Miami waterfront
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with localized higher totals up to 8 inches; risk of flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes possible beginning tonight
